case_name: Deputy Commissioner of Agricultural Income Tax and Sales Tax v. Cochin Coal Co. Ltd.

facts.text: Civil Appeal No. 380 of 1966 was filed by special leave in the Supreme Court.

anchor.surface_text: CIVIL APPELLATE JURISDICTION Civil Appeal No. 380 of 1966. Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated August 16, 1963 of the Kerala High Court in Tax Revision Case No. 17 of 1962.

facts.text: Kerala High Court passed judgment and order dated August 16, 1963 in Tax Revision Case No. 17 of 1962.

anchor.surface_text: Appeal by special leave from the judgment and order dated August 16, 1963 of the Kerala High Court in Tax Revision Case No. 17 of 1962. V. Gupte, Solicitor-General and A. G. Pudissery, for the appellant.

facts.text: Tax Revision Case No. 17 of 1962 was filed by respondent Cochin Coal Co. Ltd. against order of Sales Tax Appellate Tribunal, Trivandrum.

anchor.surface_text: This appeal, by special leave, is from a judgment and order of the High Court of Kerala dated August 16, 1963 passed in Tax Revision Case No. 17 of 1962 filed by the respondent, Cochin Coal Co. Ltd. against the order of the Sales Tax Appellant Tribunal, Trivandrum.

facts.text: Respondent Cochin Coal Co. Ltd. was a resident dealer in Travancore-Cochin during the year 1955-56.

anchor.surface_text: The facts necessary for the disposal of this appeal are as follows. The respondent-assessee was a, number-resident dealer  number resident in Travancore-Cochin  during the year 1955-56.

facts.text: The period concerned ends on September 4, 1955.

anchor.surface_text: The period we are companycerned with here ends on September 4, 1955. it used to supply companyl to companysumers in Travancore Cochin State which later became Kerala.

facts.text: Respondent supplied coal to consumers in Travancore Cochin State which later became Kerala.

anchor.surface_text: it used to supply companyl to companysumers in Travancore Cochin State which later became Kerala. For the assessment year in question  1955-56  the assessee was asked to file statements showing its turnover of supplies of companyl made to purchasers in the State of Kerala

facts.text: For assessment year 1955-56, assessee stated sales of coal to steamers arriving and berthed in Travancore Cochin State waters were not taxable because goods stored for consumption on high seas.

anchor.surface_text: For the assessment year in question  1955-56  the assessee was asked to file statements showing its turnover of supplies of companyl made to purchasers in the State of Kerala and in reply to the numberice under s. 12 2  b  of the Travancore Cochin General Sales Tax Act, it stated that the sales of companyl to steamers arriving and berthed in Travancore Cochin State waters were number taxable because the goods were stored by the steamers for companysumption on the high seas.

facts.text: Assessee did not question liability to pay tax on supplies to other consumers in Kerala.

anchor.surface_text: The assessee however did number question its liability to pay tax in respect of supplies made to other companysumers in the State of Kerala. On March 7, 1959 the Sales Tax Officer, Circle 1, Mattancherry assessed the respondent on a turnover of Rs. 1,29,352/-

facts.text: Sales Tax Officer, Circle 1, Mattancherry assessed respondent on turnover of Rs. 1,29,352/- on March 7, 1959.

anchor.surface_text: On March 7, 1959 the Sales Tax Officer, Circle 1, Mattancherry assessed the respondent on a turnover of Rs. 1,29,352/-. The respondent filed an appeal therefrom and the Assistant Commissioner of Agricultural Income Tax and Sales Tax, Ernakulam allowed the appeal in part

facts.text: Assistant Commissioner allowed appeal in part and reduced turnover to Rs. 69,407/- by omitting portion after 6th September 1955.

anchor.surface_text: The respondent filed an appeal therefrom and the Assistant Commissioner of Agricultural Income Tax and Sales Tax, Ernakulam allowed the appeal in part and reduced the turnover by omitting the portion of it after 6th September, 1955. In the result, the assessees turnover was reduced to Rs. 69,407/-

facts.text: Kerala Sales Tax Appellate Tribunal disposed of further appeal on January 2, 1962 in favour of assessee.

anchor.surface_text: There was a further appeal to the Kerala Sales Tax Appellate Tribunal. This was disposed of on January 2, 1962 in favour of the assessee. The Tribunal held that the sales being inter-State sales were, according to the decision of the Kerala, High Court in T. R. Cs. 1, 2 and 3 of 1961

facts.text: Tribunal held sales were inter-State sales not taxable per Kerala High Court decision in T.R.Cs. 1,2,3 of 1961 reported in 14 STC 850.

anchor.surface_text: The Tribunal held that the sales being inter-State sales were, according to the decision of the Kerala, High Court in T. R. Cs. 1, 2 and 3 of 1961  reported in 14 Sales Tax Cases 850  number taxable. The Tribunal held that S. 26 1  b  of the General Sales Tax Act, as amended by s. 13 ii  of Act 12 of 1957, prohibited the taxation of inter-State sales after March 31, 1951.

facts.text: Deputy Commissioner filed revision to Kerala High Court under s.15(1) of the Act.

anchor.surface_text: The Deputy Commissioner of Agricultural Income Tax and Sales Tax Central Zone, Ernakulam, went up to the High Court of Kerala under s. 15-B 1  of the Act.

facts.text: Kerala High Court rejected the revision application.

anchor.surface_text: In rejecting the application, the High Court reasoned as follows - Central Act 7 of 1956 was intended to validate State laws imposing or authorising the imposition of taxes on the sale or purchase of goods in the companyrse of interState trade or companymerce.

facts.text: Supreme Court allowed appeal and held sales tax properly leviable up to 4th September 1955.

anchor.surface_text: In the result, we hold that sales tax was properly leviable by the State of Kerala on the transactions which formed the subject matter of this case up to the 4th September 1955 but the question raised in the application for revision was number companyrectly framed

facts.text: Travancore Cochin General Sales Tax Act, XI of 1125 levied tax on sale of goods under S.3 before Constitution.

anchor.surface_text: Before the Constitution came into force, The Travancore Cochin State General Sales Tax Act, XI of 1125 levied a tax on sale of goods under S. 3 of the Act. The tax was to be paid by the dealer on his turnover in each year.

facts.text: S.26 inserted in Act by Act 12 of 1951.

anchor.surface_text: S. 26 was inserted in the main Act by Act 12 of 1951 and it ran as follows Notwithstanding anything companytained in this Act-  a  a tax on the sale or purchase of goods shall number be imposed under this Act where such sale or purchase takes place outside the State

facts.text: Bengal Immunity Company Ltd. v. State of Bihar decided on September 6, 1955.

anchor.surface_text: Then came the judgment in the case of The, Bengal Immunity Company Ltd. v. The State of Bihar and others 1  on September 6, 1955. There it was decided that the sales or purchases made by the appellant companypany in that case

facts.text: Central Act 7 of 1956 passed to validate state taxes on inter-State sales between April 1, 1951 and September 6, 1955.

anchor.surface_text: This led to  1  1955 2 S.C.R. 603. the passing of Central Act 7 of 1956. The object of the Act was to validate laws of States imposing, or authorising the imposition of taxes on the sale or purchase of goods in the companyrse of interState trade or companymerce.

facts.text: Constitution Sixth Amendment Act, 1956 came into force on September 11, 1956.

anchor.surface_text: Then came the Constitution  Sixth Amendment  Act, 1956 on September 11, 1956. It made substantial and important changes in Art. 286 of the Constitution by deleting the Explanation to Art. 286 1

facts.text: Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax Amendment Act 12 of 1957 came into force on August 7, 1957.

anchor.surface_text: Next in order of date is the Travancore-Cochin General Sales Tax  Amendment  Act, 1957  12 of 1957  which came into force on August 7, 1957. S. 13 of this Act introduced several changes in S. 26 of Act XI of 1125.

facts.text: In State of Kerala v. Cochin Coal Co. Ltd., respondent stocked bunker coal at Candla Island in Madras and sold to steamers at Cochin for 1951-52 and 1952-53.

anchor.surface_text: The case of the State of Kerala Others v. The Cochin Coal Company Ltd   was decided on October 31, 1960.
